poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Affluence"

Upon Godalming's gilded stage,
Sits a man in his gilded cage.
His distorted gaze perceives no truth,
In the struggles of the uncouth.
£100k, to him wasteful bounty, 
To others, escape from poverty's county.
Each number a silencing stone,
Upon the voiceless, alone.
How giddy, the view from atop the heap,
While beneath, the forgotten weep.
